content.question: The regions bounded by the graphs of <math alttext="y equals, the fraction 2 x over pi" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals, sine x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are shaded in the figure above. Which of the following gives the sum of the areas of the shaded regions?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, negative pi over 2, to pi over 2, of, open parenthesis, sine x, minus, the fraction 2 x over pi, close parenthesis, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, negative pi over 2, to pi over 2, of, open parenthesis, the fraction 2 x over pi, end fraction, minus sine x, close parenthesis, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, negative pi over 2, to 0, of, open parenthesis, the fraction 2 x over pi, end fraction, minus sine x, close parenthesis, d x, plus, the integral from, 0 to pi over 2, of, open parenthesis, sine x, minus the fraction 2 x over pi, close parenthesis, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, negative pi over 2, to 0, of, open parenthesis, sine x, minus the fraction 2 x over pi, close parenthesis, d x, plus, the integral from, 0 to pi over 2, of, open parenthesis, the fraction 2 x over pi, end fraction, minus sine x, close parenthesis, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from, negative pi over 2, to 0, of, open parenthesis, the fraction 2 x over pi, end fraction, minus sine x, close parenthesis, d x, plus, the integral from, 0 to pi over 2, of, open parenthesis, sine x, minus the fraction 2 x over pi, close parenthesis, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.6: Finding the Area Between Curves That Intersect at More Than Two Points

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
